statement.tex: \text{Evaluate the following integral}\\ \qquad \int_0^\frac\pi{2} \dfrac{\sin^\frac{3}{2} x}{\sin^\frac{3}{2} x + \cos^\frac{3}{2} x}\cdot dx

\\ \text{Your friend claims that }\\ A = \int_0^\frac\pi{2} \dfrac{\sin^\frac{3}{2} x}{\sin^\frac{3}{2} x + \cos^\frac{3}{2} x}\cdot dx \\ = \int_0^\frac\pi{2} \dfrac{\cos^\frac{3}{2} x}{\cos^\frac{3}{2} x + \sin^\frac{3}{2} x}\cdot dx .\\ \text{Is he/she correct in saying so?}

reason.tex: \text{Simply use the fact that, }\\ \int_a^b f(x)\cdot dx + \int_a^b g(x) \cdot dx = \int_a^b [f(x) + g(x)] \cdot dx.
